story:
Once upon a time, in a small village in India, there lived a kind and curious little girl named Priya. She loved to explore the world around her and ask questions about everything she saw.

One day, while playing near the river, Priya noticed a tiny fish struggling to swim upstream. She saw that the fish was being pushed back by the strong current, and she felt sorry for it.

Priya decided to help the fish. She thought for a while and came up with an idea. She ran back to her house and grabbed a large leaf from a nearby tree. She carefully placed the fish on the leaf and carried it upstream.

As she reached the spot where she had found the fish, she gently lowered the leaf into the water. The fish happily swam away, and Priya smiled with joy.

From that day on, Priya made it a point to check on the fish every day. She would bring food for the fish and watch it swim around happily.

One day, the fish grew very big and strong. It was no longer the tiny fish that Priya had saved. The fish swam up to Priya and spoke to her in a soft, gentle voice.

"Thank you, Priya, for saving my life. I am now big and strong, and I want to repay your kindness. I am a magical fish, and I have the power to grant you one wish. What would you like?"

Priya was surprised but excited. She thought for a long time about what she wanted. She had many wishes - she could ask for a room full of toys, or a big house, or even a magic wand.

But instead, she said, "I wish that I could help other animals and people who are in need, just like I helped you."

The magical fish smiled at her. "Your wish is granted, Priya. From this day on, you will have a kind heart and always help those in need."

And so, Priya grew up to be a kind and compassionate person who helped everyone around her. She always remembered the magical fish that had changed her life, and she passed on the kindness that she had received.

And with that, my dear child, it's time to close your eyes and dream of a world full of kindness and love. Goodnight!
